title: Christian Bale makes a pit stop at the liquor store after returning home from his movie premiere
text:
He just touched down from his recent trip to Paris for the premiere of his latest film, Ford V Ferrari.

And now, Christian Bale, 45, is back in the states but appeared to run dry of a few common household items. On Sunday, the former Batman star was spotted making a stop at the liquor store in Los Angeles after returning home.

The actor gave a big smile on his way in and headed out with a paper bag full of goodies.

Out and about: He kept it casual in a plain navy t-shirt and matching shorts for the afternoon out in Los Angeles

He kept it casual in a plain navy t-shirt and matching shorts for the afternoon out in Los Angeles.

Bale also wore a pair of black slip on shoes and black sunglasses for his quick outing.

And while he may be one of the most successful actors of our generation, the former child star recently opened up during an interview with GQ about one of his first when he was about 10 years old.

Secured the bag! Bale also wore a pair of black slip on shoes and black sunglasses for his quick outing

'One of [my] ﬁrst jobs ever was with Rowan Atkinson and I think I look at him as the template,' he said during the interview. 'He would come out, we'd say hello, but he didn't really socialize. None of us knew him – it was before he did Mr. Bean.

'And he would just become this character, but before he went on stage. And I would just watch him; I would see him becoming a character. I was mesmerized. It dawned on me that was my learning phase. I went, "Oh, that's how it's done then, is it? OK, great."'

Years later, he landed his first big role in Steven Spielberg's movie Empire Of The Sun.

Costasr: Matt Damon and Christian smile together on the red carpet for their new film Ford V Ferrari, which is going by Le Mans 66 overseas, in Paris

Bale and Damon's new movie follows the true story of a car designer Carroll Shelby (played by Damon) and Ken Miles (played by Bale) who work together to build a new race car for Ford to challenge the competitor Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans back in 1996.

The two have been doing quite a bit of press for the new film after it premiered last month at the Toronto International Film Festival.

Ford V Ferrari races into theaters on November 15
